ticket.title: Deprecation warnings give inaccurate URL
ticket.original-body:
I'm having a deprecation issue with Rails 2.1. Every now and then, I get this warning:
DEPRECATION WARNING: config.action_view.cache_template_extensions option has been deprecated and has no affect. Please remove it from your config files. See http://www.rubyonrails.org/deprecation for details.
There are multiple problems here: • First and foremost, there is *no* information regarding this issue at http://www.rubyonrails.org/deprecation . • It is hard to tell what is causing the warning. The source file referred to appears to be within the Rails 2.1 gem! • "Has no affect" should be "has no effect".
Obviously, this message should be fixed.

ticket.original-body-html:
I'm having a deprecation issue with Rails 2.1. Every now and then, I get this warning:

DEPRECATION WARNING: config.actionview.cachetemplate_extensions option has been deprecated and has no affect. Please remove it from your config files. See http://www.rubyonrails.org/depre... for details.

There are multiple problems here: • First and foremost, there is no information regarding this issue at http://www.rubyonrails.org/depre... . • It is hard to tell what is causing the warning. The source file referred to appears to be within the Rails 2.1 gem! • "Has no affect" should be "has no effect".

Obviously, this message should be fixed.

I'm having a deprecation issue with Rails 2.1. Every now and then, I get this warning:
DEPRECATION WARNING: config.action_view.cache_template_extensions option has been deprecated and has no affect. Please remove it from your config files. See http://www.rubyonrails.org/deprecation for details.
There are multiple problems here: • First and foremost, there is *no* information regarding this issue at http://www.rubyonrails.org/deprecation . • It is hard to tell what is causing the warning. version.body-html:
I'm having a deprecation issue with Rails 2.1. Every now and then, I get this warning:

DEPRECATION WARNING: config.actionview.cachetemplate_extensions option has been deprecated and has no affect. Please remove it from your config files. See http://www.rubyonrails.org/depre... for details.

There are multiple problems here: • First and foremost, there is no information regarding this issue at http://www.rubyonrails.org/depre... . • It is hard to tell what is causing the warning. The source file referred to appears to be within the Rails 2.1 gem! • "Has no affect" should be "has no effect".

Obviously, this message should be fixed.
version.title: Deprecation warnings give inaccurate URL

version.body: + 1. Also, this URL, which is hard-coded into ActiveSupport::Deprecation::deprecation_message, has no significance to those using ActiveSupport for other purposes. It should be removed altogether, and incorporated into the deprecation message on a case-by-case basis.
version.body-html: 1. Also, this URL, which is hard-coded into ActiveSupport::Deprecation::deprecation_message, has no significance to those using ActiveSupport for other purposes. It should be removed altogether, and incorporated into the deprecation message on a case-by-case basis.
version.title: Deprecation warnings give inaccurate URL

version.body: (from [ea2545fd8dfcaafcf6eff58c0afe57c55e2c6317]) Update the default deprecation message to not promise that theres more info at the Rails site [#776 state:resolved] http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/ea2545fd8dfcaafcf6eff58c0afe57c55e2c6317
version.body-html: (from [ea2545fd8dfcaafcf6eff58c0afe57c55e2c6317]) Update the default deprecation message to not promise that theres more info at the Rails site [#776 state:resolved] http://github.com/rails/rails/co...
